subject: Fashion
title: Vivienne Westwood Punk Queen
description: A micro-lesson that makes Vivienne Westwood Punk Queen usable.

hook.text: Vivienne Westwood sold safety pins and bondage gear from a shop called SEX. She called it fashion.

buildup.text: In the 1970s, Westwood and McLaren created punk's visual identity from their King's Road store.

discovery.text: She deconstructed traditional British tailoringâ€”tartan, tweed, corsetsâ€”and rebuilt them with fury.

twist.text: The punk queen became Dame of the British Empire. The establishment honored its biggest rebel.

climax.text: Westwood proved that protest and craft aren't opposites. You can rage and make exquisite things.

punchline.text: She dressed the revolution and curtsied to the Queen.

quiz.question: What was Vivienne Westwood's key contribution to fashion?
options: She invented mass-produced denim jeans for youth culture
She created punk's visual identity and merged protest with high craft
She introduced Japanese minimalism to the London fashion scene
